reviews.content: This course is a pretty good app for beginners but I would like to learn more about automation testing, app architecture for building real applications

The course was very detailed and does provide a solid foundation for beginners to explore flutter, even further. Unlike many other courses which I have taken, this course deals with the practical knowledge that one would require in a work environment. After finishing this course, I feel comfortable to take up on a new project and hopefully do well at it.

I think this course is for someone who already have some prior knowledge of flutter may be very basic, but overall course is really awesome and it really teaches everything in depth most importantly, it more focused on performance and best approach, but at the same time multiple possible possible ways of doing the same thing. Thanks Max
Max does a nice job of getting the points across. I'm looking forward to seeing some of the later, more advanced topics updated to a more current version of Flutter.
Yes it was good match. It contains all the knowledge for a beginner to reach to the stage to work on live projects in Flutter.

Good content, Max a very good way to explain how flutter works.
Something intresting about this course that let you understand the functionality behind what we are building not just building widget and copying what the instructor is doing and see the results.

Many lectures of the course need to be updated to the newer version of flutter this made me struggle a little bit to get the same results.

I learned a lot about Flutter & Dart Development in this course, however I believe that it could be better! I have also completed Max's Web Dev course and I really enjoy his method of teaching, but for this particular course especially in the later sections, it is often difficult to follow along because a lot of the code doesn't fully work anymore, often to the point that it is distracting me from the primary goal of learning to develop apps with Flutter. Thankfully, there are a lot of people who are of great help in the Q&A sections that helped me complete this course to the end. I do believe Max will be updating this course in the near future though, so I will be looking forward to that!
so out of date course i wasted more time solving error more than the time i spend on learning !

As I just finished the course I must admit that overall I'm pretty disappointed mostly due to the course not being updated and having to fix so much code that was presented in order to get anything to work. I understand that some of this is good practice but the entire second half of the course was waaaaay outdated.

My time could have been better spent. FWIW, I have been a software engineer for over 20 years and was here to learn Flutter as I have a project coming up where Flutter may be the way we go. I have over 12 years as an iOS developer and architect so I come in at a pretty high level.

One of the man concerns we have with Flutter is how often it changes and many of those changes can really break existing code. Be careful with your upgrades!

That's my main complaint. I'm sure this was a great course two or three years ago and if it gets a true update (to version 3.x of Flutter), then it would be 5 stars.

Thanks.

More than Expected.
Max is a well talent instructor. He moves from topic to a another with strategy in mind., I have to skip some chapter and go directly to later one, it was bad idea. The material is accumulated to build the knowledge.
one more thing , I came with high understanding of OOP , I thing if Max can make a dedicated OOP course in Dart all the Students will understand the concept of Flutter & Dart more effectively.

Finally , I would recommend this fantastic course to any one.
Thank You Max.

I bought this course on Udemy in 2019 when I was interested in flutter. I did not view a single video. The other course I bought is not as explicit and detailed as this. I can only berate myself for not going through this course. Would have become an expert 3yrs ago. Kudos to Max.
Already planning to get his CleanCode and NodeJS courses after mastering flutter.
Wie gewohnt ein wirklich toller Kurs. Ich d√ºrfte schon mehrere Kurse von Max durchgehen und lernen und bin immer wieder begeistert. Von mir daher 5 Sterne!

pros: big amount of material, lots of information
cons: to mutch outdated information, especcialy 13 unit, and null safety during all coure.
That is why 2,5 stars. When 13 unit is up-to-dated I'll change the score to 5 stars.

confusing
in so many lecture the instructor is rewrite the code with poor exploitation

i think he not do his best
i advice you the follow with other course

With Flutter 3 almost out, the course starts to require a refresh on some syntax/API and all the newer *Button(s) (although they are mentioned in a lot of lectures).

To make the course even better, I would also focus on testing widgets/apps (unit and integration tests) and general architecture patterns.

The instructor has a great knowledge on the subject. I can follow the course just fine. The content is great, but might be difficult for those who doesn't have any programming background. The only thing that makes me rate it 4-star is that this course is still using the old version of Flutter and Dart. I would like to see new widgets that comes with newer version of Flutter being introduced in this course. Maybe you should consider to update.
Cant follow along using newest version of flutter, spending way to much time trying to make work instead of following along and learning.
Thank you Max!! Loved this course, very well structured with thorough & clear explanation!!!

J'ai ador√©! J'ai commenc√© √† d√©velopper r√©cemment et je suis entr√© directement dans le bain avec Flutter, et ce cours est juste au top!
√ßa part des choses les plus basiques √† des outils tr√®s avanc√©s en passant par l'utilisation d'API avec Firebase.
Je recommande ce cours!

It is a great course, but I have several small objections:

1. There is a difference between arguments and parameters. Parameters are formal, arguments are concrete objects/values.

2. *Of course* it is better to write:

bool b = false;

than

var b = false;

var should be used only when absolutely necessary.
It was a very rich and educative course. I appreciate the effort Jonas put in every of his course.
The course is better than I expected. However, there are many node packages were out of date that cause me some time to figure out the proper syntax to use.

Awesome! I‚Äôve just completed the whole course and it is amazing. Certainly there are some lectures that need to be updated because there have been a lot of changes since they were recorded. However, finding the way through these (not planned) challenges have probe to be a great learning experience and most of all this is the closest you will get to face real life web dev challenges. Totally recommended!
I‚Äôve seen lots of tutorials but I haven‚Äôt seen any that interest me enough to want to see the end even when it‚Äôs so long. It‚Äôs detailed and good for beginners
I love all Jonas' courses. Great teacher who always takes the time to explain how things work under the hood, which is great for mastering the fundamentals.

This course is totally abandoned.

The latest replies I've seen from Jonas or any of the tutors are like 2 years old.

Jonas is REALLY bad at naming stuff and commenting his code. Also, he is really lazy: makes many mistakes in some videos and, instead of recording them again, he just tries to go around it by creating notes. I would not mind if these mistakes were rare, but they are everywhere.

Jonas is far from being a good developer and even farther from being a good teacher.

I definitely do not recommend this course.

Jonas is a good teacher, but this course is deprecated and yet it is advertised as for 2023. This is not honest advertising, as it's become very clear by looking at the comments on sections where I ran into major issues because things simply weren't working the same way as the instructor showed, that many of these lessons are at least 2 years old, and seemingly more than that. Beyond that, the course material is organized in a different file structure than Jonas', which has led to hours of frustration. That being said, the course is more in depth than you find most places, and covers really a lot of material. I can't say it wasn't worth the purchase, but I really think this needs some work, and the labeling is not good.

This course was great in getting my feet wet with node.js backend development.

Points for improvement would be:
1. Better solution for constant refactoring and still wanting to keep old code/comments for reference without file becoming a hot mess.
2. Adding two-factor authentication as a baseline (with sync) as most places use it nowadays.
3. Discuss Google/Facebook APIs etc. for signing user up since they are very commonplace.

As an experienced developer with some experience in Node.js I was still able to learn a lot in this course and took my skills to the next level. Thanks to Jonas, I am now able to realize the project ideas I already had in mind: secure, fast and scaleable applications will no be a problem anymore!

I signed up for this course 3 years after it was offered. In computer years that would be akin to using Snow Leopard or Windows 98. Once I tried implementing Mapbox and Stripe, everything flew out the window. Errors after errors. Bad request, cross-origin problems, can't create a Stripe Session, etc. It is very frustrating to spend 70-80 hours following along with an app taught by an excellent instructor only to see it fail at the finish line. I have purchased many Udemy courses and on a whole they have all be great and a bargain at any price. Jonad knows his s@@t better than anyone else on the platform. My critique is more about web-development in general than the course or instructor. Imagine the English or French language changing every 18 months. How would we communicate with anyone? It's Babel in the true sense of the word. Three years ago the app worked and students were satisfied. But for a new coder in 2022, taking a web development course will require an equally long JEST debugging class because nothing works as expected. This is like college before auto-save was a word function. You'd spend hours on a thesis, term paper, what have you. Have a momentary power surge and everything you worked on was lost. Web development, React, Next, Redux, Python, these are all unique and syntax specific computer programming languages. Forget to close a template literal or miss a comma and your work crashes. I learned many things but not how to fix the never ending list of JS errors. I have been invited to the restaurant, shown the menu, but not allowed to eat. M
I am really disappointed. The content desperately needs to be updated. Many of the sections shows things that are outdated. Too many issues with the code, a lot of deprecated things.
Really appreciate Jonas to make this tutorial. As Beginner for node js this tutorial is very helpful to get clear on node js, express js and also mongo BD. Really happy with this tutorial .

Great course.
The only problem -> One giant project with no mini-do-it-yourself sections
So for me it was just to copy & paste what jonas said and try to understand.

In the javaScript course there was a lot of challenges and mini-do-it-yourself sections so the learning curve was much better.

I completed the course using Typescript. This is one of those courses that has so much good information, you will probably review it many times as you build your own projects. Thanks Jonas! Great course!
Bryon
Till section 12 everything was good as the last course I took with Jonas. But from this definitely has not been updated since 2019 and mostly does not work with the way that Jonas code

Deeply intense course. I got lost quite a few times and it was frustrating but the reward was learning how to solve problems. Admittedly, I leaned heavily on the Q&A sections to get the answer. For the most part, my fellow classmates provided some great solutions that I could actually learn from. I actually like it this way so that I'm not being spoon-fed the answer. This course really made me think.
Thanks Jonas

Coming from non IT background, It was quite challenging initially but I trust Jonas and team blindly and guess what I have become more confident in web-development, improved my logic building and many more things. Every bit of this course is very well explained and implemented thoroughly. Thank you so much Jonas and team for your time and effort. It really means a lot to me.
Wow, seriously. I learned so much in this course. I've taken all of Jonas' courses and have been impressed in each one. I look forward to more current technologies, hopefully he releases more soon.

This SHOULD be a 5 star course, the project is interesting, the instructor is relatively easy to follow (though jumping around within the code having just typed a line you are trying to keep up with an understand is not helpful) and in terms of difficulty it has a good learning curve from basics to advanced.

However, it is severely let down by the age of the software versions, often using major versions many numbers out of date and with it the entire syntax becoming deprecated in places. To say that this was a headache is putting it mildly.

A students job during these courses is to understand the processes and functions being implemented, but having student tied in knots to make simple functions work is counter-productive.

There are students with questions 2 years or older in the Q&A that are left unanswered and those being responded to would really have helped smooth out a lot of these issues.

All in all I am glad to have this one out of the way but now feel like I need to find another course in order to see just how much has sunk in as expected in areas where I felt like I was putting out fires to make the code work.

Really honest review: I have completed the course and it wasn't easy tbh. I have taken other courses of Jonas before this and they were too good. Now I am not sure if I can say that for this one because I am sure Jonas is good teacher, and you get to learn a lot of things in this course. The only issue why I gave 3.5/5 is the course needs to be updated. There were so many places in between the course where Jonas's code wasn't working for me (because of the changes in packages in updates) and I wasted so much hours trying to fix them. It was really frustrating tbh. Also QnA section is dead, Assistants don't reply to our queries, thanks to students who are there to help, they are saving so much of our time. So I will say it's high time now Jonas should update his course, it's been 3 years, there are so many bugs in the course.

Good for beginners, refresher for old hands, and pleasant for KK followers. For those totally new to statistics and want to understand more they should get a text book and work through more in depth examples and return to the various sections here, and for probability KK's course on probability.

This was a great course. Krista does a great job of explaining the math behind the theory. She and Jose make a great team. I took Jose's course "2022 Python for Machine Learning and Data Science" and I wish that I had taken this course before that one as it would have made the math sections of that course a little less intimidating for me.
One small point: I had no trouble hearing and understanding Krista, but I found that I had to crank my headphone volume all the way up to hear Jose. I tried using the English captions, but that obscured part of the screen, so I turned them off.
All in all, great course. Highly recommended!!
The course is providing a good overview of fundamental concepts that I haven't touched since my undergraduate days...some 35 years ago.

I have no doubt that this course is top-notch. and that many students will benefit greatly by it. I would disagree with the statement that the course is right for someone with 'basic math skills'. My situation is fairly unique, in that I am retired, no longer have ambitions of full time employment, and I just want to write better Python, maybe for the occasional paying project, but basically as a hobby. My goal with this course is to not be totally lost, armed with a data science cheat sheet. I might suggest that you advise 'basic math and algebra skills' as a prerequisite, and perhaps (LOL) 'the willingness to learn a foreign language.' If I walk away with enough to build a block of code, with enough background to use google and a cheat sheet to get me there, then I'm happy. I'm hoping to acquire sufficient background knowledge, with this course, to be able to do that. I do think, however, that your course is better suited for someone seeking a higher threshold than I am.
Exactly what I was looking for - deepened my understanding of what can be done - and why - with R Studio etc.

I finished the course, took me two months to finish it understanding the concepts.

The course is matching the expectation and I appreciate the effort both teachers are putting into slicing and dicing complex topics.

On the other hand, I feel like the explanation quality is a bit skewed on the "easy side", while more complex demonstration or deep dive are dealt a bit lightly. But I can see this being a choice in order to avoid creating a repulsive course for early starters.

As I wrote in the course I am having little problem grasping hand-writing of the teacher, but I can see this being very subjective.
Some of the exercises are bugged (but mostly solved in Q&A).

In the end I am seeing an HUGE opportunity for a Math for Data Science part.2 with more complex topics and more depth with the same style, I really like the idea of focusing on the theory without jumping straight in into programming. I'll be in.
Have to revisit quartiles again and see the reasoning for quartiles.
Previously complex terms of Statistics couldn't be understood clearly whenever I studied, from others. But these are explained in a very simple and crystal-clear way.
It is good, but a little slow for me. I am only through to number 9 so it is still early.

I have progressed almost 25% of the course and it has already exceeded my expectations. Krista delivers the content around Math perfectly and easy to understand. Thanks to Jose for this collaboration!

Great course, but it would be great to see a linear Algebra with eigenvectors, to understand how PCA dimensional reduction works, plus a little bit about the computational geometry to understand SVM, and Lagrange multipliers. If you can, please add these topics, or create a Math for Data Science Masterclass second chapter that will include these parts ;)

To this point, I am finding it a bit slow (I have run some videos at 1.25 speed), but well explained. As I get into areas that I am less sure about I expect to appreciate the careful explanations more.
Simple and effective till now.
Amazing clear explanations, feels easier to understand because she has a "beginners-mind" approach, makes it very clear to understand complex lessons. Thank you Ms King!
It's good so far. I hope the quiz questions later in the course show the workings.
The maths is very well explained. I have never done this type of maths before It really has helped me clarify the mathematical processes and the purpose the maths we are covering. Great work!!
I love Jose's class! He is the best instructor among everyone else. I pretty much purchased most of his classes! Look forward to learning more from him, thank you Jose!
A very clear and detailed explanation of every topic. I needed a review of statistics and probability, and this is perfect.

Krista went to the trouble of explaining the n-1 for sample variance. Everyone else handwaves about why this seemingly "voodoo" correction is there, but she explained it in a way that was understandable.

Much of this is review of material I have rarely used, so I I find it most helpful as I am considering work in data science where a fresh knowledge of the material would be so useful. And, I know from previewing the syllabus that some of the later material is really new for me. So, yeah, great stuff. The pacing and explanation is top notch!

This course covers all the things you need to start a react-native development. I am actually developing a react-native application at the moment which I've learned to built by reading documentations online. This course covers all the essentials which I wish I'd learned before I started my project.
Great for beginners and great for developers who have some experiences on react-native too, as the lecturer also explains in depth why certain things are implemented in a certain way.
i recommend this to all entry level , intermediate , and also expert. good explanation with practical
Great course. I took Max' react course beforehand and this one was just as good as the react one. Good explanations with practice possibilities.

A very detailed and comprehensive course on React Native. I had some difficulties the first time I took the course, which were related to outdated React Navigation modules. Fortunately the course was updated and even improved.
I got my money's worth out of this course and it benefited me greatly.

The creator of this course is very good at explaining procedures. Great learning experience and a ton of content. I couldn't get an item or two to work perfectly but I understand these things are difficult to maintain as dependencies change rapidly.
The updated course is worth your time and all concepts are well explained thanks Max

I really wanted to like this course...
1. projects are uninteresting and unappealing, i know its not a design course, but he could have spend a bit more time on improving the style, and add animations.
2. the javascript used many times is not modern and very "bulky", not sure why he doesnt use modern javascript as he has a js course.
3. some topics are outdated, which didnt bother me that much as its part of tech, but he could have added a few written warnings and walkarounds.
4. lack of animations part, which can be very important in apps.
5. the code refactoring...it's quite confusing, the switch from local to database and leaving the previous code i think it was lazy. I consider that that part should have been a new small project and not try to push everything in one project...starting a project as its supposed to be its quite important in planning an app
6. the auth part just shows poor programming and lazyness...

Great course. Concepts are really well explained. I wish it would have taught how to make a sideways scrollable modal in a view or how to implement ads, but you learn a lot of the core React Native Components and how to implement Native Features. Definitely will recommend this course to others.

As always, this is a course from Max that exceeds all expectations!

I definitely learnt a great deal from this and I recommend this course to anyone who is interested in learning cross-platform mobile development with React Native.

PERFECT COURSE 100%,
i finished about 50% of it only in 5 days, the flowing of the sections is amazing following the steps is easy, Maxi explain each movement he do, it is clear that a team of experts work on together to construct that course in this way, i hope they get the maximum benefit of it, they really DESERVE.

Very Bad Explanation, instead of teaching us core topics he is just telling you to buy his other course but he can explain it within a few min. He is making too many components that are not needed because it doesn't make any sense. I am very disappointed and totally not recommended it if you are a beginner.
Maximillian is a great teacher, I learned a ton. Repetition is key and this course really drills in the basics which is wonderful. Thank you!
Really amazing! Going through this App course with the knowledge of React makes things easier!!
Amazing job in teaching this course. Projects are great and you have time to experiment and try by yourself

Very good course, well constructed and easy to follow. Lecturer knows his stuff and is able to explain everything very clearly.

Edited:
Was interested in the 1 star reviews and tbh I feel like they don't really make a lot of sense. I feel like this course has a lot of value and gives you a very good base to start you mobile development journey from. Ofcourse there are things that could be optimised and there were also things that I would have done or would have written differently, but that doens't mean it's a bad course.
Programming is a very broad field that has so much information that may or may not be relevant to you and in this course you get a pretty good clear cut understanding of where and how to get started.

Keep up the good work.
One of the best courses I enrolled at, Max you are a very dedicated developer. I can't thank you enough mate!
A practical course accompanied by in-depth explanations of the concepts. Very satisfied with the quality of the teaching.
I had problems with understanding screen switching and react logic, I can't remember the logic clearly I just copy your logic how can I think the logics by myself?
Very detailed and in-depth explanations of all the concepts.

The course has a great content with React Native, but I am a little bit confused with onChangeText + bind() method to make a new function that is the same as (changedValue) => inputChangedHandler('amount', changedValue). It is a bit more difficult to understand. But overall, it is great to know this approach!
recommended for beginners
good
Nice concepts
best cousre and the istructor is good at replaying the reponses
NICE
Nice explanation, have the right amount of examples and excercises for the topic and each video contains a summary with what you've learned, a good way to know your overall progress.

Lazy Programmer's courses are amazing. Simple but still detailed explanations, easy to follow and he does an amazing job at challenging you to do things yourself. The course is broken up into beginner, intermediate, and advanced parts, which makes it easy for all students to follow along in spite of their level of experience. All of them were great!
The practical application lectures were really useful.

High - quality content explained through theory and code on practical examples (datasets). The way how everything was explained and structure is for praise. Full support for author to continue with good work and creating extraordinary contents. This course will impact on me to do further research of the topic of Naive Bayes and implement it practically.

I believe a lot of effort was put into this course, and it is sold for a reasonable price even though that one-time purchase gives you an unlimited amount of knowledge in a sense because this course never stops being updated

One of the best python courses in Udemy. The course is well organized, Step-by-Step approach with detailed explanations, and continuous improvement by adding new lessons. Great learning resources to implement in a real-world application.

One of the best courses on udemy in learning python. I have saw a lot of courses about python but this one is the best I encountered and show indeed everything you need to know to master python..Not only just the language but also data analysis, machine learning, webapps, software, games.
The course is still ongoing so conclusion is..THIS IS THE ONLY COURSE YOU NEED TO BECOME A COLMPLETE PROFESSIONAL PYTHON DEVELOPER AND DATA ANALYST AND MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER;

NOTE:
The course is still ongoing and there will be addes more section weekly.

the teacher is also very responsive and response very fast.

The only downside is that I can only give it 5-stars..The course deserves a lot more then 5 stars :-)
so by this said..I give 5+++++++++++ stars :-)

I am beginning to think that oriental people have a talent for teaching. I have bought courses not only from this course but also from other oriental teachers and it is always explained in such a way that you not only understand it but also have a lot of fun. I have also bought courses from Mossen Hassan as well as from Zaid sabih which had nothing to do with Python and are more in the financial area but there it was also explained very well. Be that as it may. This course has made me really fun. And everyone who knows me knows that I learn a lot and am very critical. You can tell that he is really interested in explaining the subject matter to his students in an understandable way. He takes the time to draw everything and explain it slowly and very precisely. My respect for people who focus on their students.
Interesting the baby steps we're taking.

Great experience to learn here and the mentor is charming.
I was stuck in my project and requested his help, he came forward immediately and did. Also, he added one lecture regarding that thing is really lovely gesture.
The way he explains the concept is easy to understand.
Mohamed is experienced in many fields ,sure you will find this is an interesting course
It is convenient to hear, see, and learn, ... thanks. I enjoy learning during my free time ..
The Course is easy to follow and clear explanations.
really step by step, easy to understand
great
THE WAY PRESENTED.
easy and clear
great

I have zero experience and I am able to easily follow along. Mouhammad does an amazing job to make it as simple as possible and all the additional resources and help he offers to ensure your success is amazing.
the python part of course good. Problem with working with the editor. instructor doing things with editor not explained
so far amazing!
One of the most comprehensive, easy to follow and well structured courses on Udemy. This took my skills to the next level! This is by far the best resource I've found for learning data science.

The theory is well explained however, almost everything practical is outdated. The course had so many things that were unnecessarily complicated things added to itself, that weren't properly explained in my opinion. If you need to learn the basic theory of AI, this is something good. However, if you need anything that learns you how to implement it, or that learns you how the AI works (with numpy, rows, etc.) you definitely need a lot of preknowledge. I'm a bit disappointed with this course. Hence the two stars.

It's pretty good, however it would be better if they provide a VM with the necessary environment to run the code from the exercises, (especially for DOOM). They should also cover some newer models such as transformer neural network, which is the same that has been used for training the new chatGPT from openAI. The programming exercises are really good if you try and implement your own code along side with the instructor without looking at the videos, but only listening to the audio of him explaining the reasoning behind the code.

Overall, this course is pretty dope. Keep it up!
Overall good code and examples, but more detailed explanations about code would be better.

The introduction gives a clear idea of the steps to take.
At the half-way point I am getting an idea of the possibilities of AI as it improves its decision-making as it iterates.
I love this course, I just need to relearn and relearn about the courses. Thank you Kirill, Hadelin and teams!

The course was really Good. I just need to learn more because the coding was really hard for me as I just started to jump in to Technology Word.
I would like to thank Kirill, Hadelin and teams!

Rana

Door de accenten van de docenten is het voor no-natives lastig te volgen en de ondertiteling werkt daardoor ook niet.
Ook is het materiaal soms verouderd waardoor het soms lastig is om een bepaalde les te volgen / reproduceren.
Het motiveert niet echt om het dan vol te houden. Ook ben ik bezig met mijn "eigen" AI implementatie en daar zou ik graag wat vragen over willen stellen. Onderdelen die je lastig vind, wat verder uit te diepen. De opgegeven extra lesstof is niet voor iedereen zomaar te begrijpen en daardoor is deze cursus achteraf niet de meest verstandig voor mij.

the instructions for installation are out date.
it was hard to identify the correct program from the website advised.

The intuition lectures were really good, but I had a lot of trouble keeping up with the practical sessions. I think it's better to mention in advance that some prerequisite knowledge of pytorch and object-oriented programmed is highly recommended. Otherwise, it is just a code along project without really understanding what is happening.
Not that easy to correlate the theoretical material with the practicle one, especially to whom is not familiar with torch package

#1 They need to update this. Doom doesn't work?
#2 The theory is great, but some people enjoy the math behind everything.
#3 More coding and more examples (AND UPDATED EXAMPLES) would be great.
i am still learning a lot, I cant wait to finish this course.

Please, how do I get the files needed for lecture 15. Gitwolrd setup???
I don't see any link.

Learning wise this course teaches what it intents to do. Course is a bit old though so Doom and Breakout do not work or require extra effort to get them to work. Course needs an update. Having recommendational readings is nice.

This course was a waste of my time and money.

On the one hand, I had to search most of the concepts externally because I did not understand many things (and a lot of Q&A from other students were on the same line).

Furthermore, most of the videos seems to be made only to fill out the course. It is too frustrating that topics that can be explained in 5 minutes are explained in 15 minutes repeating the same over and over again, leading to ambiguous explanations. Even instructors seem lost sometimes!

On the other hand, I couldn't follow along the practical lessons due to installation problems. They use old versions of the libraries and it was impossible for me to install them after losing so much time trying.

Finally, like in other courses of these instructors, Q&A is completely useless and all of the assistants seem bots that don't know how to answer any question.

Obviously, I wasn't the only student with that problems because others had commented the same problems in the lessons. There are even questions with these problems asked years ago. So, it is a pity that this course was abandoned years ago.

The good thing is that this is the last course of the AI collection that I bought from these instructors. I will try to stay away from their courses in the future.

Theory is ok.
The practical section is the problem. It is a collection of videos explaining the code already written by the instructor.
If possible I would request a refund.

The theory parts of the course were great but the coding part was basically non-existent. If you want to get started in the field of deep learning, go learn Tensorflow and take a course on that. This course should only be bought if you want to learn theory.
It was a good experience. Lot of Information gained about AI. Thank you so much.

Hey everybody! I will write a long review for you.
I juuuust managed to finish this bootcamp that i started a little bit less then 6 months ago.
My only preview experience was another Udemy Course, a free one, HTML + CSS 4hours, so basically no previous knowledge so you will find my review from this point of view.
First. My rating 1/5 Doesn't reflect the real value, is just a WARNING for you(future students), for Angela and her team. The course is shamefully outdated (it has 828547 participants!!!!, tons of money made!!!) in key chapters, BUT Angela is a very nice teacher, sweet person and sweet voice, gave us a lot, a lot of priceless informations and i totally recomand her, but i want to make a comparison. Year 2000 film camera vs 2022 DSLR cameras, the one in year 2000 was good at that time, but is not up to date to with the actual tehnologies and i will try to give you a preview of different chapters.
This course covered a lot of topics and in the same time i feel like we didn't made a deep learning in any of them.
I start with a comparison, the free course that i have made before gave me more infos then Angela in first 5 sections.
Then section 6. Bootstrap, sadly..it was outdated.
Also i feel like we didn't practiced enough to sediment the infos in bootstrap, javascript, jQuerry,
Section 21 Git also very outdated, lost few hours to figure out how to login
Section 25 SQL, we almost did nothing in it.
Section 33 React. She registered when was React 16.8, now is 18.1+ the syntax is diferent(ok, no big deal) but i gave up and coded like her in 16.8 otherwhise i had to lose a lot of time and focus changing at every leason, small details but will annoy you for sure.
I choose this bootcamp because had a lot of hours of it, what i saw in comments a lot of important things were not mentioned like other Hooks (we only learned useState), no flexbot, no grid.
Until section 33 the course was registered between 2018 and 2019.
What was updated for Year 2022 was only section 34-39 (Web3, BlockChain, Crypto Token/Coin, NFTs) that i feel had to be in a totally separate Course, sure it was in trend, the blockchain, crypto, nfts were exploding and was a good marketing thing (meanwhile at the end of 2022 everything is down ^.^). Anyway this chapters were very very very rushed, just few challanges , you just can watch her coding.

Another important thing and i saw a lot of people writed in reviews: Sadly the front-end is not connected to back-end to really build a proper website! The concept is called MERN, look for it!

A funny part is that i started a 2022 bootcamp and i finished a 2023 one =) great!
Again, WARNING! has nothing in it updated for 2022-2023 yet.
And another WARNING, watch out on Udemy style too. You cannot filter the reviews by date, they just put them "random"(or not) 6 months ago, 3 days ago, 2 years ago and so on, it would be great to sort them by the most recent, most upvoted, most recommanded, like in the course, but they specially made it like this to catch you.

BUT overall i don't regret doing this course, i really got a lot of infos for very few euros.

Having just finished this course, I must say it is fantastic. I have been working with JavaScript professionally for two years in my role as a SysAdmin, creating automations for different business processes from automatically processing employee account lifecycles, (creating new accounts for on-boarding, keeping them up to date with info changes, and processing off-boarding) to keeping asset inventories up to date, and pushing commands to devices remotely (such as lock commands for lost devices).

I've had to leverage different data types and structures, control operations/methods, and HTTP requests to various APIs quite a bit so felt fairly comfortable in my knowledge set, but was entirely self-taught via quite painful trial and error and spending hours and hours combing through documentation. Honestly, my knowledge and skills were rather patchwork and I was using some quite antiquated coding technique, so I decided to take this course to fill in a lot of gaps and develop a much more solid foundational understanding of JS, especially more modern ES6 features and techniques.

This course absolutely delivered and is what I wished I had when I was first starting to hack together my first rudimentary JS scripts. Jonas, over the course, builds from the very basics of syntax through to teaching how to build a front end web application with rather sophisticated features in a very thorough, methodical, and systematic way with a knack for explanation that is understandable and enlightening.

Perhaps the greatest strength here is that Jonas goes out of his way to not just hash out some code and say what it does, but actually delves into how things work and reinforces and builds on this knowledge as the course progresses so nothing that you are doing on any of the several projects seems hidden inside a black box.

Even with my prior work and experience in JS, I can say that my knowledge and skills, as well as confidence, has grown an order of magnitude and I consider this a tremendous return on my investment in Jonas's course and highly recommend it to anyone wanting a solid foundation in JS from which to continue to grow. I am looking forward to taking a few more courses that Jonas has here on Udemy, as well as developing some of my own projects and heavily refactoring all my previous code.

Many thanks to Jonas for this course, truly appreciate the level of detail and attention he has put into it.

I have been working as a Salesforce developer/ software engineer for quite some time. Salesforce has its own UI framework for building front-end applications/ lightning web components. I just finished the full course, and my feelings toward this JS course are mixed.

The first 70% of the course are really well-made, I'd rate it as 4/4+ (out of 5). Everything is well covered, plenty of useful info, I really don't have anything bad to say.

The quality of the content is dropping as we are approaching the end of the course. The Mapty project was really interesting, but in things started to get messy.

The final project - Forkify - was a mess. Yes, I am a novice programmer and I didn't expect to just easily walk through the final project, but the Forkify lesson should be re-made from scratch. The MVC architecture was not well explained in the MVC lesson, so I bet plenty of people just started copy/pasting the code after passing the MVC lesson. It took some time for the famous "a haaaa" moment to happen in my brain. My advice to you would be to add a new project to the course, after Mapty and before Forkify. In that project people should practice how to import/export a bunch of modules & classes. Five .js files could be enough for that program, before increasing their number to 10,15+.
The call-stack, event loop, runtime environment and closures could all be much better explained. I saw some amazing videos about those topics on YT that helped me understand those concepts and mechanisms.

I will rate this course as average / could be better (3).
Forkify is like and an anchor that is pulling the grade of this course down. Redo it please, not for me, but for future people who are starting with JS.

I've never taken a course on Udemy that's provided so much value at this price. You tell that Jonas is meticulous on making sure his students understand everything that is going on in the code.

Date: 3 Nov 2022
TLDR: I recommend the course.

NEGATIVE (UDEMY issue): I hate that they start asking for reviews after the first video. It must drive instructors crazy. It would be nice if we could see (and search/sort by) how far a reviewer was in the course, when they left their review. Many reviews seem to be from people who clearly didn't finish the course or get far into it at all. I have finished this course.

NEGATIVE (UDEMY issue): The English captions are ok, for the most part. However, there are a lot of mistakes in them. I wish I had access to them, I'd have fixed them along the way.

English is my first language, but I always use subtitles, in any event. I didn't find Jonas hard to understand. Jonas speaks slowly and clearly. (So slowly I did the course at a higher speed) For people like my wife, who have English as their second (or more) language the subtitles should be better. It seems the English subtitles were manually created, so when considering the problems in them, I really fear for what the auto-generated other languages look like.

HARD NEGATIVE: I would have liked to join the Discord group, but it requires my phone number. Firstly, I don't have a smart phone. Even if I did, I wouldn't be giving out my phone number. Most of my own family doesn't even have my phone number! Not having a smart phone does not mean I'm not a human being, fully capable of contributing to society! I'm a member of many discord communities, and I've never seen this requirement before. I personally consider it a violation of privacy, and would never consent to such a thing. I don't have the ability to participate in his discord, and I removed an entire ‚≠ê from my rating, for this, alone. It‚Äôs a shame since I own all of his courses.

NEGATIVE: I didn't really care too much for his style of continually adding more and more code to a section, and in the end leaving one big mass of code with everything commented out. I feel like that makes it more difficult when you return later to look for something you want to review. I personally used my own system to create sections in individual files, to keep track of things, but the mass of code in one file with huge sections commented out as we go, drove me nuts.

NEGATIVE: The section on Git, is the very last section in the course. I think students would benefit from having it very early on. Maybe even in the first set up sections, so that we could be using it all along, and become comfortable with its use throughout the course. This with multiple files throughout the course and keeping the code "cleaner" as we work through the lessons would benefit students more, I think.

POSITIVE: There are quite a few coding exercises and a challenges. I'd have liked more! You don't learn by watching videos, you learn by doing. Over and over. I don't think you can have enough exercises and challenges. If you do them, and make sure you fully understand the topic, before moving on, you'll get the most from the course.

POSITIVE: Jonas put a ton of time and effort into the course. If you take the time to UNDERSTAND the topics before you move on, there is a lot to learn. Don't be afraid to use external resources (MDN, stack overflow, W3schools, YouTube, etc.) to strengthen information you are weak on. Sometimes having something explained in a different way can drive it home. I'm sure even Jonas has to look things up.

NEUTRAL: JavaScript supports both object-oriented programming with prototypal inheritance as well as functional programming. While functional programming is touched on in the course, that's about it. If the course ever gets another major overhaul, I'd really like to see functional programming more central to the content.

Your course is nice and helpful. A good crash course in tensorflow. However, after attempting the developer exam after your course, you cover a lot of extra, superfluous things that are not on the exam, while not covering core, key concepts that would have been more helpful on the exam. More time should be spent on LSTMs, different types of nlp classification, and time series. You should also go into more detail about ways to increase accuracy, such as dropouts, batch normalization, and how the types of layers you show actually work. The exam is tested on how well the models do, and in most sections of the course, none of the models perform all that well. In your fashion mnist example you only build a model that is 90% accurate, but you can get it to 99%, so if that came up on the exam, using the techniques you showed would not garner a passing grade. If you intend for this course to be enough for someone to pass the exam you need to cover things more in depth and show how to get models performing at the highest caliber possible.

Hi, this is a review from someone who completed the entire course.
I think a lot of reviews are excited people who've reviewed it before completing it - which is really cool but not always the most accurate.

Immediately I'd recommend this course to anyone. It teaches you the both the editor and c# scripting.
In particular Rick is a very, very good teacher. He goes over things in a good pace and also explains everything well.
Both Gary and Rick also to make sure that nothing is assumed and show what they ask you to do and do it themselves so you can follow along if you get lost.

My main critique is Gary's lessons - I think Gary also has a good pace, and also makes sure to demonstrate a lot that he does, but I found when he was doing certain things with scripting in particular I got really lost. Like he uses certain terms or words in scripting and just assumes that you know if he created his own variable or if it's something that already comes with unity etc etc.
I also think Gary does really well, but he does have the more harder content to demonstrate, so in that regard he's fighting uphill with harder content which isn't fair on him to be the fall guy for those two sections.

Overall I think these directed lessons helped me more than any undirected youtube series has and now I feel set up for any future udemy courses or even undirected youtube tuts.
In the end I definitely dont feel ready to make my own simple game yet but I'm confident I can get there now.

If you're wondering whether the course is worth it, the TLDR is YES - it's worth the money and it stops you wasting time on youtube that is less focused.

Thanks guys and I'll be onto the next course !

I've enjoyed the course and I have already purchased a couple of other similar ones. I think some of the C# concepts in the Quiz game and Space shooter are just a bit harder to grasp. Overall though it's great value and a really good way to get into C# coding.

My first ever Unity game development course, overall it is awesome :)

Although some part might be too quick or too hard to understand at first hand, it is encouraged also to do some survey when you have something just doesn't understand or just because of your own curiosity.

Since I already have programming experience, I am very used to survey some part by myself, but for no-coding-experience learners, it is very important to also build a habit, not only just asking questions, but also:
- try to understand, read through Unity manuals
- search through course questions, usually some other people already have questions you might wonder, in this case you could refer to the solutions
- survey on Google
- when related to Coding problems (like C# thingy), websites like Stackoverflow is a good place to search for answers
All in all, it was an amazing course, for beginners with lots of basic and somewhat advanced concepts. I really liked the "challenges" concept.
